kdl.prox.util
Class Assert

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.util.Assert

public class Assert
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class that defines static assertion methods.

Parameters:

condition

public static void condition(boolean isTrueCondition,
                             java.lang.String failMessage)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
One arg overload, throws IllegalArgumentException (containing failMessage) if isTrueCondition is false. Does nothing if it is true. Used to assert some important condition is true, for example:

Assert.condition(threshold >= 0, "threshold must be positive");

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

isInvalidName

public static java.lang.String isInvalidName(java.lang.String name)
Parameters:
name -
Returns:
top-level method to determine if name is valid. Used to see if a container name, attribute name, or attribute column name doesn't have invalid characters. returns a non-null String (sentence) if name is not valid. In this case the String describes why that is the case. Returns null if the name is valid. Valid container names must be non-null and non-empty StringS that don't contain any characters in Container.INVALID_NAME_CHARS
